cast.text:
GM Purple! üü™ Sharing /gmfarcaster for the latest #retropgf in /purple. We've now streamed 149 episodes of GM Farcaster, sharing /farcaster news and proliferating FC builders on multiple platforms, including streaming live 3x a week on YouTube, Twitter, @unlonely and within our own Streamyard platform, plus sharing recordings on all podcast platforms including Spotify and Apple. 

During the past 3 months, in addition to our usual stream, we've had a few guests pop by including @wwarren from /matcha, @mazmhussain and @betashop.eth on /moxie launch day. 

We also launched /castout at the beginning of onchain summer, a Survivor inspired game, with 16 players and a /bracket, highlighting and utilizing different games and projects in the Farcaster and @base.base.eth ecosystems. Read all about it in the @paragraph post below.

(continued in reply)

https://paragraph.xyz/@gmfarcaster/castout

html.ogDescription: As Onchain Summer was announced, I had a crazy idea: what if I created a Survivor inspired game that was played completely on Farcaster?

text:
There are no women on Farcaster.

I didn't know @linda @nounishprof and @christin changed their gender!!

In case you missed it

Here‚Äôs a preview of what‚Äôs changing with channels

1. Nothing is changing this week

2. There will be a bunch of communication to channel owners about the changes (beyond just casts)

3. One point of clarification that I saw come up yesterday: membership does not require your channel to have a token. Can you choose to do that? Yes! Are you required? No. Your channel, your rules.

If you have feedback, feel free to reply to this cast or send me a DC. 

https://warpcast.notion.site/Upcoming-channel-changes-1056a6c0c101800caee6ea8133f8f966

I may be the person who‚Äôs most excited for  Channel Memberships

Here‚Äôs whyüëá

I‚Äôve long argued that the current iteration of channels feels more like topic tags than Communities. You choose a topic when casting and then your cast goes to people interested in that topic. 

Community is different. Community is a group of people organized around common goals. Layer on onchain and it‚Äôs: common goals + collective ownership! 

A big part of our vision is that every channel member is a member-owner with skin in the game. 

When you come to a channel community in a couple weeks you‚Äôll be prompted to buy a membership via Fan Tokens ‚Äî which gives you access to the channel, partial ownership of it, AND shared participation in all rewards earned by the channel. 

This is the way.

Hey all, I‚Äôve decided to sunset automod.

Channels are changing and Automod needs to adapt to work well with the new design. I like the new direction for channels and think it makes the right trade offs but it requires major changes and a renewed commitment that don‚Äôt make sense for me at this point.

Real quickly:
- Automod will run until the changes go into effect.
- All remaining subscription time will be refunded.
- Automod is now open source with APIs to port moderation configurations.

I‚Äôve worked on automod nearly everyday for the past 7 months. I‚Äôm proud of it and thankful to everyone who gave it a shot.

Thank you.

A thread of snippets from automod codebase that may be of interest to ppl building on farcaster.

‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì

1. Server driven config that made it possible to add rules in minutes w/o writing any ui code.

Sample config: https://github.com/jtgi/automod/blob/main/app/lib/validations.server.ts#L309-L360
Field generator: https://github.com/jtgi/automod/blob/main/app/components/curation-form.tsx#L777

text:
Automod originally used unstable internal APIs. Seeing it work influenced the evolution of channels, and mod bots became a first class part of the spec.

You can talk about why it's impossible to create anything, or you can create something that shows what's possible.

Respect to @jtgi and all who "show, don't tell."

seems like some folks rush to perform the rain dance when they see a developer make time for themselves or chase a different thing. Farcaster will be fine, the problems are straightforward.

podcasting took a decade+ to iterate on RSS feeds (awful UX), and today no one is saying podcasting is dead anymore (good UX).
We're launching a new experiment to help users avoid the spam label.

I often see people Farcaster isn't "sufficiently decentralized".

You're free to define what "sufficiently decentralized" means to you, of course, but how we think about it is laid out in Varun's blog post.

https://www.varunsrinivasan.com/2022/01/11/sufficient-decentralization-for-social-networks

html.ogDescription: A design pattern to reduce centralized control and change incentives in social networks.

text:
This week, I started writing a new profile series called ‚ÄúVIPs (Very Interesting People) of Farcaster.‚Äù

The idea was simple: Counter the false narrative that ‚Äúthere are no interesting people on Farcaster‚Äù by highlighting some of the best and brightest on this app in a daily @paragraph, mintable on @base.base.eth. 

On days 1-5, I featured @ccarella.eth, @yonfrula, @burrrrrberry, @mikedemarais.eth and @nounishprof, and you can find them all at https://paragraph.xyz/@toadyhawk or in the /farcaster-vips channel.

html.ogDescription: he was a skater toad, she said seeya later toad

text:
A quick word about my /farcaster-vips series on @paragraph. 

TL;DR: 

After week one, I‚Äôm:

- In awe of prolific writers on this app like @yb @kaloh @six etc. ü§Ø 
- Grateful for the overwhelming support of the FVIP series so far üíõ 
- Thankful to my first 5 VIPs for sharing and boosting the articles @ccarella.eth @yonfrula @burrrrrberry @mikedemarais.eth @nounishprof 
- But‚Ä¶ realizing that daily cadence was just too ambitious for features of this length üòÖ
- So‚Ä¶ going to switch to 3x per week starting tomorrow. üóìÔ∏è 

Thanks for understanding, more here on Paragraph:

https://paragraph.xyz/@toadyhawk/vip-cadence

html.ogTitle: A Quick Word About the Farcaster VIPs Series
html.ogDescription: Last week, I decided to start a new series called Farcaster VIPs (Very Interesting People), to try to counter the false narrative that there aren‚Äôt interesting people on the purple app. You can read the first five features by scrolling down on this Paragraph, or over on warpcast in the /farcaster-vips channel. Originally, my plan was just to send a single long cast every day, highlighting one person who is building and contributing on FC and constantly bringing value to the network.

Snapchain is an upgrade to hubs that makes syncing data between Farcaster apps fast and reliable. 

Our proposal was just updated to support: 

1. Multiple writers, so no single party controls access. Neynar will run a writer on day one.

2. Sharding, so we can scale to support 100x the number of users
